data.title: All 129 John Travolta Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to relive the magic of iconic performances as we take you on a journey through the rich and diverse filmography of John Travolta. From his breakout role in â€˜Saturday Night Feverâ€™ to hisâ€¦
data.text:
Mildred Waters

Â·

Follow

48 min read

Mar 17, 2024

--

Get ready to relive the magic of iconic performances as we take you on a journey through the rich and diverse filmography of John Travolta. From his breakout role in â€˜Saturday Night Feverâ€™ to his dramatic turn in â€˜The Boy in the Plastic Bubbleâ€™, this roundup is a must-read for fans and cinephiles alike. Prepare to be captivated, entertained, and inspired by the versatile talents of one of Hollywoodâ€™s most beloved actors.

1. Nightmare (1974)

Nightmareâ€ (1974) is a chilling crime-drama-thriller that blurs the line between victim and perpetrator. Released on January 8, 1974, the film, which has a runtime of 1 hour and 13 minutes, stars Richard Crenna, Patty Duke, and Vic Morrow. Directed by William Hale and written by David Wiltse, the movie is produced by CBS Television Network and Mark Carliner Productions.

ğŸ“º Watch now free with Prime

In the chilling horror film â€œThe Devilâ€™s Rainâ€ (1975), a satanist cult leader meets an explosive end at the hands of the local church. Unbroken by his demise, he vows to return, hunting down and enslaving every descendant of his congregation by harnessing the power of the Book of Blood Contracts.

In the 1976 drama â€œThe Boy in the Plastic Bubble, â€œ John Travolta stars as a teenager born with a rare immune system disorder, confined to a germ-free bubble. His life takes a dramatic turn when the spirited girl next door, played by Glynnis Oâ€™Connor, moves in and challenges him to break free from his controlled environment.

A captivating coming-of-age story, it follows the journey of Tony Manero, a young Italian-American struggling with the harsh realities of family life and the looming uncertainty of his future.
